Utilities

rxrmask.utils.density_profile(thicknesses, densities, roughness, step=0.1)[source]

Calculate density profiles for multilayer structures with interface roughness.

Parameters:

  • thicknesses (list) – List of layer thicknesses in Angstroms.

  • densities (dict) – Dictionary mapping element names to density arrays. Each array contains density values for each layer.

  • roughness (dict) – Dictionary mapping element names to roughness arrays. Each array contains roughness values for each interface.

  • step (float, optional) – Spatial resolution for the profile in Angstroms. Defaults to 0.1.

Returns:

A 2-tuple containing:

  • z (np.ndarray): Array of spatial positions in Angstroms.

  • dens (dict): Dictionary mapping element names to density profile arrays.

Return type:

tuple

Example

>>> thicknesses = [10.0, 20.0, 15.0]  # Layer thicknesses
>>> densities = {'Fe': [0.0, 5.0, 3.0, 0.0]}  # Fe density in each region
>>> roughness = {'Fe': [2.0, 1.5, 2.5]}  # Interface roughness
>>> z, profiles = density_profile(thicknesses, densities, roughness)
rxrmask.utils.step_function(z, zi)[source]

Step function for sharp interface transitions.

Parameters:

  • z (np.ndarray) – Array of spatial positions.

  • zi (float) – Position of the interface transition.

Returns:

Array with values 0.0 for z < zi and 2.0 for z >= zi.

Return type:

np.ndarray

rxrmask.utils.z_density_profile(z_eval, thicknesses, densities, roughness)[source]

Calculate density profiles at specific spatial positions.

Computes atomic density profiles at user-specified spatial positions, rather than on a regular grid. This function is useful when density values are needed only at specific locations, such as for fitting or when interfacing with other calculations.

The calculation method is identical to density_profile() but evaluates the density functions only at the provided z positions, making it more efficient for sparse sampling.

Parameters:

  • z_eval (array-like) – Array of spatial positions where densities should be evaluated.

  • thicknesses (list) – List of layer thicknesses in Angstroms.

  • densities (dict) – Dictionary mapping element names to density arrays. Each array contains density values for each layer.

  • roughness (dict) – Dictionary mapping element names to roughness arrays. Each array contains roughness values for each interface.

Returns:

A 2-tuple containing:

  • z (np.ndarray): Array of input spatial positions (converted to numpy array).

  • dens (dict): Dictionary mapping element names to density arrays

    evaluated at the specified positions.

Return type:

tuple

Example

>>> z_points = [5.0, 15.0, 25.0]  # Specific positions of interest
>>> z, profiles = z_density_profile(z_points, thicknesses, densities, roughness)

Density profile utilities for RXR-Mask.

This module provides functions for calculating atomic density profiles in multilayer structures, including the effects of interface roughness.
